oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Major General Bushrod Rust Johnson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Copy negative of painted portrait of Confederate Major General Bushrod Rust Johnson (1817-1880) wearing formal [military] clothing. Image shows a portion of a wooden frame.

Graduated from West Point Military Academy, 1840. Served in Mexican War, 1846-1847. Prof. in Kentucky Military Institute, 1848. Superintendent of Military Univ. of Nashville, 1851-1861. 1861, Colonel, Prov. Army of TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Johnson, Bushrod Rust
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Calvert, Peter Ross, 1855-1931; Calvert, Ebenezer, 1850-1924
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Calvert Brothers Studio Glass Plate Negatives
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Armed Forces--Officers; Lapels; Collars; Neckwear
Generals; Military officers; Military personnel
